snippet.title: Police struggle against year-long crime onslaught on Coast suburb
snippet.content: POLICE are struggling with a surge in crime at one Sunshine Coast suburb, as officers urge residents to lock up and report anything suspicious. Senior Constable Ann Jessop said there had been a continuing issue with property offences in Pelican Waters for the last year. "A number of these offences have been committed by offenders from outside the district with no apparent links to Pelican Waters in particular," Snr Const Jessop said. Sunshine Coast Crime Prevention Unit Sergeant Yvette Tarrier urged residents to keep security in mind. "Please take a moment to take simple safety precautions to check that your property is locked and secured," Sergeant Tarrier said. Property on Sovereign Circuit, Sylvie St and Tilney St have all been targeted over the last few weeks with break and enters, unlawful use of motor vehicles and thefts from vehicles. Residents have been told to contact police immediately if they see anything suspicious and in an emergency, call 000. Anyone with information for police can contact Policelink on 131 444 or provide information using the 24 hours a day. To report crime anonymously to Crime Stoppers, call 1800 333 000 or visit .
